gettingStartedSteps.name: Basic Instructions
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Press the power button; the four digit food code will blink.
  2. To use a plate or other container to weigh food, put the empty container on the scale and then press the TARE button.
  3. Find the desired food code in the food code booklet. Enter the 4 digit food code number starting with 1 or 0.
  4. Put the food on the scale; calculations will appear in the display window.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Quick Tips and References
gettingStartedSteps.description:
• For instructions on computing a meal, see page 7 of your manual.
  • For instructions on programming and using custom food codes, see page 8 of your manual.
  • Do not place food on scale before turning on. The scale auto-tares if things are placed on the weighing surface before it is turned on.
  • For information on TARE, see page 6 of your manual.
  • For information on cleaning your scale, see page 9 of your manual.

1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).
  3. Press and hold the SET button.
  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SET button to select.
    Enter: USER NUMBER*, GENDER, ATHLETE MODE*, HEIGHT, and AGE.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8).
    *ATHLETE MODE - An athlete is defined as a person who is involved in intense physical activity approximately 12 hours per week and who has a resting heart rate of approximately 60 beats or less per minute.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Scale

gettingStartedSteps.description: Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight. Make sure that your feet are making good contact with all four metal conductors.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Weigh
Setting up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.

  2. Place on a hard flat surface.

  3. Tap the "POWER/ZERO" button to turn the scale on; if the scale does not
    read 0, tap the "POWER/ZERO" button to zero out the weight.

  4. Begin weighing. Center objects for most accurate weight.
    *Scale will turn off after 60 seconds of inactivity.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Monitor
gettingStartedSteps.description:
It is important to set the clock before using your blood pressure monitor so that a time stamp can be assigned to each record that is stored in the memory.

  1. When the display is off, hold the "Start/Stop" button for about 3 seconds to enter set-up mode.
  2. Press the "UP" arrow (MEM button) or the "DOWN" arrow (USER button) to change the year, then press the "SET" button to confirm the selection.

  3. Once you select "SET," the next steps will appear on the screen as follows:

  4. After setup is complete, the screen will display "done," show each of the entered settings, and turn off. The monitor is now ready to use.

1. Fasten the cuff on your upper arm, then position the tube off-center toward the inner side of the arm in line with the little finger.
  2. The cuff should be snug but not too tight. You should be able to insert one finger between the cuff and your arm.
  3. Sit comfortably with your arm resting on a flat surface.
  4. The middle of the cuff should be at the level of the right atrium of the heart. Before starting the measurement, sit comfortably with your legs uncrossed, feet flat on the floor, and back and arm supported.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Fastening the Cuff

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. With the monitor off, press the "Start/Stop" button to turn on the monitor.
  2. If necessary, toggle which user you want to measure as by pressing the "USER" button.
  3. Press the "Start/Stop" button again. The blood pressure monitor will begin the reading and finish the entire measurement.
  4. Press the "Start/Stop" button to power off. Otherwise, the monitor will automatically turn off within 1 minute of the reading.


IMPORTANT

  • Resting for 5 minutes before measuring will give you the best reading.
  • Wait at least 3 minutes between measurements. This allows your blood circulation to recover.
  • For a meaningful comparison, try to measure under similar conditions. For example, take daily measurements at approximately the same time and position of upper arm, or as directed by a physician.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Starting the Measurement

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Open battery cover.
  2. Install the batteries by matching the correct polarity, as shown.
    *Always use AAA batteries.
  3. Close the cover.
    Replace the batteries whenever shows, the display dims, or when the display does not light up.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Installing Batteries
Setting Up Your Bluetooth Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Make sure your phone's Bluetooth is turned on.

  2. Select "Bluetooth Set-up" in the Weight Gurus App menu.
    *If asked, make sure to fill out a few more pieces of information about yourself. This will set up your body metrics calculation.

  3. Press and hold the "UNIT" button on the back of the scale. Once the small circles start bouncing back and forth on the scale's screen, you can let go of the "UNIT" button.

  4. Tap the "+" symbol on your phone's screen to begin the pairing process.

  5. Your phone's Bluetooth will connect with the scale and then bring up another screen. Tap on the picture of your scale to choose it.

  6. Select your user number. Manually select your user number on the scale by using the arrow buttons and then tapping "SEL." Then, step on and weigh yourself.

  7. When the pairing process is completed, your phone will alert you that pairing is complete.

1. Remove the tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Place the scale on a clean, level surface. Press the "ON/OFF" button on the right side of the scale; the four digit food code will be blinking.
    *Note: To ensure proper calibration, please do not touch the scale surface while turning on the device. Contact with the surface during start-up may result in a displayed error ("UNST"), in which case, simply turn off the scale and then turn it back on by pressing only the "ON/OFF" button.
  3. To use a plate or other container to weigh food, put the empty plate or container on the scale. Press the "ZERO" button.
  4. Find the desired food code in the food code booklet. Enter the four digit food code number starting with 1, 2, or 0.
  5. Put food on the scale; calculations will appear in the display window.

    OPTIONAL
  6. Press the "G/OZ" button to toggle between English (lb/oz) and metric (g) units of measurement.
  7. Press "SAVE" to store nutritional information.
  8. Press "TOTAL" to view stored nutritional information. Press "TOTAL" again to exit total mode.
  9. To weigh another food item, press "CLEAR" and repeat steps 2 through 4.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Getting Started
Setting Up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.

  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).

  3. Press and hold the SEL button.

  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SEL button to select.

  5. Enter: USER NUMBER*, GENDER, ATHLETE MODE*, HEIGHT, AGE, and WEIGHT MODE*.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8).
    *WEIGHT MODE - Select Traditional or Weightless: # for Traditional mode to see
    your weight (125.6lbs) or +/- for Weightless to track your weight
    progress (-12.3lbs).
    *ATHLETE MODE - An athlete is defined as a person who is involved in intense
    physical activity approximately 12 hours per week and who has a resting
    heart rate of approximately 60 beats or less per minute.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Weigh
gettingStartedSteps.description:
Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight. Make sure that your
feet are making good contact with all four metal conductors.

*If desired, press SEL to toggle between Traditional and Weightless modes when viewing your results.

1. Press SYNC on your scale as it's showing your measurement results.

  2. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.

  3. Hold your device above your scale's LCD screen. When the display shows the
    barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your device.
    Press SUBMIT to store your results.
gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync Video

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.

  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).

  3. Press and hold the SEL button.

  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SEL button to select.

  5. Enter: USER NUMBER* and WEIGHT MODE*.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8)
    *WEIGHT
    MODE - Select Traditional or Weightless: # for Traditional mode to see
    your weight (125.6lbs) or +/- for Weightless to track your weight
    progress (-12.3lbs).
gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Scale

gettingStartedSteps.description:
Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight.

*If desired, press SEL to toggle between Traditional and Weightless modes when viewing your results.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Weigh
How To Sync
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Press SYNC on your scale as it's showing your measurement results.

  2. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.

  3. Hold your phone above your scale's LCD. When the display shows the barcode,
    your results will automatically be transferred to your smartphone. Press SUBMIT to store your results.

name: C-Pod Vista Blend
staticHTML:
WHERE WE STARTED

We love the convenience of single-serve coffee during a busy morning. But after throwing away too much plastic and tasting one too many  lifeless cups of coffee, we were sure there had to be a better way.  How, we wondered, could we make a great-tasting, convenient cup  of coffee without being wasteful or steeping it in plastic? As we dove deep into the world of craft brewing, we found that a simple cup of coffee is anything but simple. We learned that perfection is the result  of a chain of good decisions stretching from farm to cup. Now that we knew our grounds would cross continents to get to you, we went on a mission to make the right choices for everyone. We sought out the best beans, responsibly raised and perfectly processed, and found a way to preserve their fresh-ground flavor all the way to your doorstep.  By delivering our blends in an innovative packing solution called c-pods, we’ve created flavorful single-serve coffee with a conscience.

It takes a precise balance of conditions to grow the best beans.

THE PERFECT BEAN

The story of Rise Coffee starts  in the soil. The perfect beans come from the right seeds raised at the right balance of temperature, humidity, moisture, and altitude. These plants thrive in a special mix of conditions, creating complex flavor. Once we learned what makes a quality bean, we decided that only the top 2% of Arabica beans harvested worldwide met our standards.

Our beans are air-roasted, so you never get a burnt taste in your cup.

THE ROASTING PROCESS

Next, we traveled across the country to unlock the secret of how to turn those fresh beans into truly great coffee. After a lot of conversations with passionate people, we found a craft roaster who thought about quality the same way we do, treating every cup with care from start to finish. They have developed a unique air roasting method that prevents burning by heating the entire batch evenly, so your coffee is never bitter. As soon as the beans are roasted, though, a clock starts ticking—the longer they are exposed to oxygen, the more flavor they lose. Our expert roaster taught us that fresh coffee can’t be put in traditional single-serve cups right away, so it begins to go stale while it sits waiting on the shelf. We package our grounds while they are still warm from the roaster, sealing in their peak flavor. Then, we store them in nitrogen-filled, almost oxygen-free bags, effectively stopping the clock on flavor loss while they are on the way to your kitchen.

Our c-pods keep grounds fresher than a traditional single-serve cup can.

A NEW FORMAT

We’re able to package our grounds as quickly as possible and  at prime freshness because we discovered c-pods, an alternative to traditional single-serve cups. C-pods brew each serving in a filter, instead of plastic, so every cup has more flavor. Less plastic also means less waste, and a more environmentally friendly cup of coffee.  We wanted to make single-serve coffee better for you and our planet, and we think c-pods are the solution. A cup of Rise lifts up each person along its journey, from maker to taster, so you can be confident with every sip that you’ve chosen the greater good.

CHARITY PARTNER

C-pods are part of the Rise family of products, which uses  innovative, eco-friendly design and responsible sourcing to create better single-serve coffee. To further protect the health of the environment, Rise collaborates with an international charity called Pure Earth, which works to clean up toxic pollution in  developing countries. Greater Goods donates a third of the  profits we make to our charity partners, so they can continue their valuable work.

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove c-pod from bag. DO NOT remove foil seal.
  2. Place c-pod in the brewing chamber. To make the best cup of coffee, set the brew size to 8oz.
  3. When the brew cycle finishes, remove the c-pod from the chamber. DO NOT reuse.
    *After brewing, the c-pod will be hot and may drip. PLEASE USE CAUTION when removing the c-pod.

    For optimal freshness, consume all the c-pods in one bag within 2 weeks of opening. Keep the bag sealed.
gettingStartedSteps.name: USING THE C-POD

1. Remove the tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Place the
    scale on a clean, level surface. Press the "ON/OFF" button on the right
    side of the scale; the four digit food code will be blinking.
    *Note:
    To ensure proper calibration, please do not touch the scale surface
    while turning on the device. Contact with the surface during start-up
    may result in a displayed error ("UNST"), in which case, simply turn off
    the scale and then turn it back on by pressing only the "ON/OFF"
    button.
  3. To use a plate or other container to weigh food, put the empty plate or container on the scale. Press the "ZERO" button.
  4. Find the desired food code in the food code booklet. Enter the four digit food code number starting with 1, 2, or 0.
  5. Put food on the scale: calculations will appear in the display window.

    OPTIONAL
  6. Press the "G/OZ" button to toggle between English (lb/oz) and metric (g) units of measurement.
  7. Press "SAVE" to store nutritional information.
  8. Press "TOTAL" to view stored nutritional information. Press "TOTAL" again to exit total mode.
  9. To weigh another food item, press "CLEAR" and repeat steps 2 through 4.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Getting Started

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Make sure your phone's Bluetooth is turned on.
  2. Select "Bluetooth Setup" in the Weight Gurus App menu.
    *If asked, make sure to fill out a few more pieces of information about yourself. This will set up your body metrics calculation.
  3. Press and hold the "UNIT" button on the back of the scale. Once the small
    circles start bouncing back and forth on the scale's screen, you can let
    go of the "UNIT" button.
  4. Tap the "+" symbol on your phone's screen to begin the pairing process.
  5. Your phone's Bluetooth will connect with the scale and then bring up another
    screen. Tap on the picture of your scale to choose it.
  6. Select your user number.
  7. Manually select your user number on the scale by using the arrow buttons and then tapping "SEL." Then, step on and weigh yourself.
  8. When the pairing process is completed, your phone will alert you that pairing is complete.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Bluetooth Smart Scale Setup
Setting Up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. The first thing you’ll want to do is remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale to activate the batteries.
  2. Then, place the scale on a hard, flat surface.
  3. To change between Kilograms and Pounds, use the unit button on the back side of your scale.
  4. Now all you’ll need to do is step on and weigh yourself.

name: Appsync Smart Scale + Body Composition BBB

gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).
  3. Press and hold the SEL button.
  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SEL button to select.
    Enter: USER NUMBER*, GENDER, ATHLETE MODE*, HEIGHT, and AGE.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8)
    *ATHLETE MODE - An athlete is defined as a person who is involved in intense
    physical activity approximately 12 hours per week and who has a resting
    heart rate of approximately 60 beats or less per minute.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Weigh
gettingStartedSteps.description: Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight. Make sure that your feet are making good contact with all four metal conductors.

gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Press SYNC on your scale as it's showing your measurement results.
  2. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.
  3. Hold your device above your scale's LCD screen. When the display shows the
    barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your device.
    Press SUBMIT to store your results

1. Slide off the battery cover.
  2. Install the batteries by matching the correct polarity, as shown here. Always use the correct battery type (2 x AAA batteries).
  3. Replace the cover.

Replace the batteries whenever the following happen:

  • appears.
  • The display dims.
  • The display does not light up.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Installing and Replacing the Batteries

gettingStartedSteps.description:
It is important to set the clock before using your blood pressure monitor, so that a time stamp can be assigned to each record that is stored in the memory. (year: 2014 - 2054 , time format: 24 H / 12 H)

  1. When the monitor is off, press and hold the “POWER” button for about 3 seconds to enter into setting mode. The blinking numeral represents YEAR.
  2. Press the “ARROW” button to change the YEAR then press the "SET" button to confirm your selection.
  3. Use the “ARROW” and “SET” buttons like you did in the previous step to
    confirm MONTH, DAY, TIME FORMAT [24 hours or 12 hours], HOURS,
    MINUTES, and the MEASUREMENT UNIT.
    IMPORTANT! Most doctors in the United States use mmHg (millimeters of mercury) as the measurement unit.
  4. After confirming the measurement unit, the LCD will display all the settings you have done once again and then turn off.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Time, Date, and Measurement Unit

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove all accessories (watch, bracelet, etc.) from your wrist. If your physician has diagnosed you with poor circulation in one wrist, use the other one.
  2. Roll or push up your sleeve to expose the skin.
  3. Apply the cuff to your wrist with your palm facing up.
  4. Position the edge of the cuff about 1-1.5 cm away from your palm.
  5. Fasten the wrist cuff around your wrist, leaving no extra room between the cuff and your skin. If the cuff is too loose, the measurement will not be accurate. Rest for 5 minutes before measuring. Wait at least 3 minutes between measurements. This allows your blood circulation to recover.

NOTE: For a meaningful comparison, try to measure under similar conditions. For example, take daily measurements at approximately the same time and on the same wrist, or as directed by a physician.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Fasten the Cuff

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. When the blood pressure monitor is off, press the “POWER” button to turn it on. The LCD will display the user ID first. Press the “UP” button to change the user ID between User 1 and User 2. Press the “SET” button to confirm, and it will finish the whole measurement for the selected user.
  2. Press the “POWER” button to power off. Otherwise, the device will turn off within 1 minute.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Start the Measurements

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight.

gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.

  2. Hold your phone above your scale's LCD. When the display shows the barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your smartphone. Press SUBMIT to store your results.

1. Make sure your phone's Bluetooth is turned on.
  2. Select "Bluetooth Setup" in the Weight Gurus app menu.
    *If asked, make sure to fill out a few more pieces of information about yourself. This will set up your body metrics calculation.
  3. Press and hold the "UNIT" button on the back of the scale. Once the small circles start bouncing back and forth on the scale's screen, you can let go of the "UNIT" button.
  4. Tap the "+" symbol on your phone's screen to begin the pairing process.
  5. Your phone's Bluetooth will connect with the scale and then bring up another screen. Tap on the picture of your scale to choose it.
  6. Select your user number. Manually select your user number on the scale by using the arrow buttons and then tapping "SEL." Then, step on and weigh yourself.
  7. When the pairing process is completed, your phone will alert you that pairing is complete.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Bluetooth Scale

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).
  3. Press and hold the SEL button.
  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SEL button to select.
  5. Enter: USER NUMBER*, GENDER, ATHLETE MODE*, HEIGHT, and AGE.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8).
    *ATHLETE MODE - An athlete is defined as a person who is involved in intense physical activity approximately 12 hours per week and who has a resting heart rate of approximately 60 beats or less per minute.
gettingStartedSteps.name: SETTING UP YOUR SCALE

gettingStartedSteps.description: Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight. Make sure that your feet are making good contact with all four metal conductors.
gettingStartedSteps.name: WEIGH

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Press SET on your scale as it's showing your measurement results.
  2. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.
  3. Hold your device above your scale's LCD screen. When the display shows the barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your device. Press SUBMIT to store your results.
gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync
Setting Up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight.

gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.
  2. Hold your phone above your scale's LCD. When the display shows the barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your smartphone. Press SUBMIT to store your results.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale.
  2. Tap the scale awake (briefly step on, then off the scale).
  3. Press and hold the SEL button.
  4. Use the UP and DOWN arrows to make selections, then press the SEL button to select.
  5. Enter: USER NUMBER*, GENDER, ATHLETE MODE*, HEIGHT, and AGE.
    *USER NUMBER - Your personal user profile number (Select user 1-8).
    *ATHLETE MODE - An athlete is defined as a person who is involved in intense physical activity approximately 12 hours per week and who has a resting heart rate of approximately 60 beats or less per minute.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Weigh
gettingStartedSteps.description: Step on the scale and evenly distribute your weight. Make sure that your feet are making good contact with all four metal conductors.

gettingStartedSteps.name: How To Sync
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Press SYNC on your scale as it's showing your measurement results.
  2. Open the Weight Gurus App's Camera/Sync function.
  3. Hold your device above your scale's LCD screen. When the display shows the barcode, your results will automatically be transferred to your device. Press SUBMIT to store your results.

1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale to activate the batteries.
  2. Place scale on a hard, flat surface.
  3. Tap the “power” button to turn it on.
  4. Begin weighing. Center items on scale to ensure accuracy.

Tips:

  • To change the measuring units, tap the UNITS button to switch between grams, ounces, fluid ounces, and milliliters.
  • To cancel out the weight of the dish, tap the Zero button and wait for the screen to show zero. Then, begin adding your food.
  • Use the lock button if you need the screen to stay on for 5 minutes without movement otherwise the scale will go into sleep mode after 30 seconds and will shut off after 3 minutes.
gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Scale

gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Make sure your phone’s Wi-Fi is turned on.

  2. Open the Weight Gurus app, swipe the screen to the right, and then select "Wi-Fi Set-up” from the drop-down menu.

  3. Follow the steps within the app to finish setting up your user information and connect your scale.

First, it’s important to clean your phone thoroughly with the supplies included in your package.

  1. Clean your phone screen with the alcohol swab.

  2. Wipe the screen down with the microfiber cleaning cloth.

  3. Apply the anti-dust sticker onto the screen and then remove it, blotting any remaining dust.


Then apply your screen protector using the easy application clip.

  1. Place the clip onto the bottom of your phone. Make sure the prong in the middle of the clip is fully inserted into the charging port of your phone, and the bottom of your phone is resting snugly against the clip.

  2. Peel the transparent protective film off the back of the screen protector before applying. Be careful not to touch the adhesive side of the glass.

  3. Align the bottom edge of the screen protector with the top of the clip. Make sure the glass on either side of the center button is flush with the clip. Then ease the glass down onto your phone, smoothing out any air bubbles as you go. The clip will act as a guide, keeping the glass straight.

1. Remove the plastic pull tab from the back of the scale. 

2. Place on a hard, flat surface. 

3. Tap the "POWER/ZERO" button to turn the scale on; if the scale does not read 0, tap the "POWER/ZERO" button to zero out the weight. 

4. Begin weighing. Center objects for most accurate weight. 

5. Scale will turn off automatically after 60 seconds of inactivity.  Press the HOLD button to keep the scale on for 5 minutes while not in use.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Setting Up Your Wi-Fi Scale
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. Make sure your phone’s Wi-Fi is turned on.

  2. Open the Weight Gurus app, swipe the screen to the right, and then select "Wi-Fi Set-up” from the drop-down menu.

  3. Follow the steps within the app to finish setting up your user information and connect your scale.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Cleaning Your Knife
gettingStartedSteps.description:
We do not recommend putting your knife in the dishwasher. All quality chef knives are made with specialized metals that are best for holding a sharp edge, but also are more prone to tarnishing and rust. It’s important that you:


  1. Hand wash your knife with dish soap and water after each use.

  2. Dry your knife immediately with a soft cloth.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Storing Your Knife
gettingStartedSteps.description: When you’re not using it, keep your knife in a wooden block to protect the blade from getting chipped or bent.

gettingStartedSteps.name: Proper Cutting Technique
gettingStartedSteps.description:
1. We recommend using a wood or bamboo cutting board.

  2. Pinch the blade with your pointer finger and thumb near the handle or grip the handle by wrapping your fingers and thumb completely around the handle. We do not recommend putting your pointer finger on top of the blade, because this makes the knife unstable and gives you less control.

  3. Hold your ingredients in your free hand, with your fingertips curled inward towards your palm for protection.

  4. Push the knife forward, while applying downward force, in a slicing motion to make a clean and even cut. The side of the blade should lightly graze the knuckles of your free hand, while your fingertips remain curled inward. Push ingredients toward the blade with your free hand.

  5. To prevent chipping the blade, make straight cuts in a rocking motion and avoid twisting your knife.
